article_title: Dan Pashman on office eating, and Charles Fried on King v. Burwell.
article_text: Last week the Supreme Court heard arguments in King v. Burwell, the case that could undo Obamacare. Now, as far as we can tell, lawyers who disagree with the Obamacare law always seem to find the policy unconstitutional. Today on The Gist, Harvard law professor Charles Fried is the lone exception. Plus, Dan Pashman from The Sporkful podcast brings reason and order to the Slate office fridge. For the Spiel, it’s time for another lobstar of the antentwig.

article_metadata.sailthru.subheadline: Dan Pashman from The Sporkful podcast sizes up the Slate office fridge and offers tips for improving your communal kitchen.

article_summary:
Last week the Supreme Court heard arguments in King v. Burwell, the case that could undo Obamacare.
Now, as far as we can tell, lawyers who disagree with the Obamacare law always seem to find the policy unconstitutional.
Plus, Dan Pashman from The Sporkful podcast brings reason and order to the Slate office fridge.
Today on The Gist, Harvard law professor Charles Fried is the lone exception.
For the Spiel, it’s time for another lobstar of the antentwig.
